PropertyFinder.Stats

Class ChartCentralPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • PropertyFinder.AppPanel
              • PropertyFinder.Stats.ChartCentralPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarChart, PieChart

    public abstract class ChartCentralPanel
extends AppPanel
    A special panel to be inserted in a StatsSubPanel. It contains a statistic result calculated from the dataset it's given.
    Version:
    25.03.2018
    Author:
    Danilo Del Busso
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChartCentralPanel

        public ChartCentralPanel(java.lang.String title,
                         java.util.List<AirbnbListing> listings,
                         int lowPrice,
                         int highPrice)
        Create a new Central Panel to be displayed in the StatsSubPanel. Initialise range bounds, set layout and append a JTextArea as well as creating the chart that will be displayed.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the panel.
        listings - List of all results from the CSV file.
        lowPrice - Lower price boundary of the properties the user wants to see.
        highPrice - Upper price boundary of the properties the user wants to see.

    • Method Detail

      • createBottomBox

        protected void createBottomBox()
        Creates box at the bottom of the panel showing some information

      • initialiseExponentialBounds

        protected void initialiseExponentialBounds()
        Initialise bound values for graphs. Divide them in 4 categories using natural exponential function

      • initialiseLinearBounds

        protected void initialiseLinearBounds()
        Initialise bound values for graphs. Divide them in 4 categories using natural exponential function

      • getTotFromData

        protected java.lang.Double getTotFromData(java.util.List<AirbnbListing> listings,
                                          double lowPrice,
                                          double highPrice)
        Calculate total number of listings in given price range from a given dataset of listings
        Parameters:
        listings - the dataset used for calculation
        lowPrice - the lower bound of the price range
        highPrice - the upper bound of the price range
        Returns:
        Return the total number of listings in given price range from a given dataset of listings

      • getAvgFromData

        protected java.lang.Double getAvgFromData(java.util.List<AirbnbListing> listings,
                                          double lowPrice,
                                          double highPrice,
                                          java.lang.String column)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculate the average value of a column values from the listings.
        Parameters:
        listings - the dataset used for calculation
        lowPrice - the lower bound of the price range
        highPrice - the upper bound of the price range
        column - the column name used as filter for calculation. It has to be a column containing numerical values
        Returns:
        the average value of a column values from the listings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • calculateExponentialBounds

        protected java.lang.Double[] calculateExponentialBounds(int divisions,
                                                        int lowPrice,
                                                        int highPrice)
        Use natural exponential function {y= [(π/2 + e)^x] / [Σ_{i=1}^𝛿 (π/2 + e)^x )]} to calculate percentages and values of bounds given upper and lower bound of price
        Parameters:
        divisions - the parts the price has to be divided in
        Returns:
        an array containing the bounds needed

                                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> hashMap)
        Returns the borough by its key value in the given hasmap
        Parameters:
        i - the position (e.g. 1 is the element with the highest number of listings)
        Returns:
        the borough by its key value in listingsPerBorough
